question: Stars twinkle because
option1: the intensity of light emitted by them changes with time
option2: the distance of the stars from the earth changes with time
option3: the refractive index of the different layers of the earth's atmosphere changes continuously, consequently the position of the image of a start changes with time
option4: the light from the star is scattered by the dust particles and air molecules in the earth's atmosphere
answer: the refractive index of the different layers of the earth's atmosphere changes continuously, consequently the position of the image of a start changes with time
